text: at quick if we take a look at Insider sales for the past month there's a couple in here that are a little heavy so we can see like this changing 23 18 of ownership this stuff doesn't look too crazy 5 4 that's people generally taking comp out on things that are at really high levels on a relative basis so don't don't hate them for that at all but this is a little interesting because these are these are bigger these are absolutely bigger trades and let's see what they have going on and you can see that there's a little bit of a rationale here so this says uh transaction represents automatic sale of shares to cover required tax withholding obligations in connection with the vesting of restricted stock units so yeah nothing in here that is alarming to me then a lot of this looks to be structurally driven so yeah I mean from an insider trading perspective I like to see if there's big sponsorship flipping around and definitely more on the sell side than buy side there's absolutely no doubt about that but it doesn't look like there's a mass ACC or anything like that so when I think about Palante here I think about a stock that's had a really good run um who knows how far it goes there's a lot of wind at its back from a pure trading lens it's still showing strength so until it doesn't show strength that's

text: that so when I think about Palante here I think about a stock that's had a really good run um who knows how far it goes there's a lot of wind at its back from a pure trading lens it's still showing strength so until it doesn't show strength that's when I change my opinion I apply basy and statistics I'm not out here making calls like people talk about I don't care at all about that I care about making money money and a big part of that when you come to analyzing the price of individual tickers is applying aasian analysis that means as new information comes out we then change what we're doing based on that new information and it's simply because it's difficult from a Traders perspective to project out what might be in 52 weeks I have no idea what can happen over 52 weeks so there's no way I could say I love this thing a year out from now because my job as a Trader is to trade movements as they're happening now from a value Traders or value investors perspective it's completely different they're looking to find things that are at really good relative values compared to the probability of the business doing really well in the future and they play those longer room longer moves dealing with the shorter term price variation so just a difference in approach really really interesting article there's nothing in there that I think is off
